title: Starter Path
description: Quick onboarding path for learning the basic PD vocabulary and major implementation stages.

steps.title: CMOS Fundamentals
steps.summary: Foundation note for CMOS behavior and MOSFET concepts with focus on intuition, vocabulary, and why device effects matter later in timing and layout decisions.

steps.title: Logic Synthesis
steps.summary: Synthesis-focused note describing the path from RTL intent to implementation-ready netlists, with emphasis on constraints, optimization goals, and handoff quality.

steps.title: Physical Design Inputs
steps.summary: Input-readiness note clarifying required design files, constraints, and library consistency checks that prevent downstream physical design noise.

steps.title: Floorplanning
steps.summary: Execution-oriented note for floorplanning with focus on objectives, macro placement reasoning, power planning dependencies, and early congestion risk control.

steps.title: Placement
steps.summary: Placement lab note centered on timing/routability tradeoffs, legalization quality, and the debug loop between congestion signals and optimization moves.

steps.title: Clock Tree Synthesis
steps.summary: CTS note focused on skew/latency tradeoffs, buffering strategy, and the practical checks needed before and after clock tree optimization.

title: Handoff and Optimization Path
description: Focus on synthesis quality and the transition from logical optimization to implementation-ready handoff.

steps.title: Logic Synthesis
steps.summary: Synthesis-focused note describing the path from RTL intent to implementation-ready netlists, with emphasis on constraints, optimization goals, and handoff quality.

steps.title: Advanced Logic Synthesis
steps.summary: Advanced synthesis lab note covering physical-aware optimization ideas, multibit strategies, and practical tradeoffs used before and during implementation handoff.

steps.title: Physical Design Inputs
steps.summary: Input-readiness note clarifying required design files, constraints, and library consistency checks that prevent downstream physical design noise.

steps.title: Floorplanning
steps.summary: Execution-oriented note for floorplanning with focus on objectives, macro placement reasoning, power planning dependencies, and early congestion risk control.

steps.title: Placement
steps.summary: Placement lab note centered on timing/routability tradeoffs, legalization quality, and the debug loop between congestion signals and optimization moves.

title: Lab Notes Maintenance Path
description: Track how the `.site` test domain documents experiments, sources, and implementation notes separately from `.top`.

steps.title: Implementation Case Notes
steps.summary: A lightweight area for project-style implementation notes, case studies, and experiment summaries for the `.site` lab version.

steps.title: Reference Index
steps.summary: Reference index for the `.site` lab version, used to keep source lists separate from the `.top` siteâ€™s long-form citation page structure.
